description: User sign-up with email creates new account and session
steps: Step 1: POST /api/auth/sign-up/email with valid email and password
Step 2: Verify response contains user object with id and email
Step 3: Verify session cookie is set in response
Step 4: Verify user is created in database

description: User sign-up fails with invalid email format
steps: Step 2: Verify response returns 400 Bad Request
Step 3: Verify error message indicates invalid email

description: User sign-up fails with duplicate email
steps: Step 1: Create a user with email 'test@example.com'
Step 3: Verify response returns appropriate error
Step 4: Verify error message indicates email already exists

description: User sign-in with valid credentials returns session
steps: Step 1: Create a test user account
Step 2: POST /api/auth/sign-in/email with correct email and password
Step 3: Verify response contains user object
Step 4: Verify session cookie is set

description: User sign-in fails with wrong password
steps: Step 1: Create a test user account
Step 2: POST /api/auth/sign-in/email with correct email but wrong password
Step 3: Verify response returns unauthorized error
Step 4: Verify no session cookie is set

description: User sign-in fails with non-existent email
steps: Step 2: Verify response returns appropriate error
Step 3: Verify no session cookie is set

description: User sign-out invalidates session
steps: Step 1: Sign in as a test user
Step 3: Verify response indicates successful sign-out
Step 4: Verify subsequent requests with old session fail

description: GET /api/auth/session returns current session for authenticated user
steps: Step 1: Sign in as a test user
Step 3: Verify response contains session data with user info

description: GET /api/auth/session returns null for unauthenticated user
steps: Step 2: Verify response indicates no active session

description: Protected endpoints reject unauthenticated requests
steps: Step 1: Call a protected endpoint without session cookie
Step 3: Verify error message indicates authentication required

description: Sign-up form displays and validates input
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /signup or registration page
Step 2: Verify email input field is present
Step 3: Verify password input field is present
Step 4: Enter invalid email and verify validation error displays
Step 5: Enter valid credentials and submit form
Step 6: Verify redirect to dashboard or confirmation page

description: Sign-in form displays and handles authentication
steps: Step 2: Verify email input field is present
Step 3: Verify password input field is present
Step 4: Enter invalid credentials and verify error message
Step 5: Enter valid credentials and submit

description: Protected routes redirect unauthenticated users to login
steps: Step 2: Navigate to a protected route (e.g., /dashboard)
Step 3: Verify redirect to login page
Step 4: Sign in with valid credentials
Step 5: Verify redirect back to original protected route

description: List exercises returns paginated results
steps: Step 2: Verify response contains exercises array
Step 3: Verify response includes pagination metadata (total, page, limit)
Step 4: Verify exercises array length is at most 20

description: List exercises filters by category
steps: Step 2: Verify all returned exercises have category 'chest'
Step 4: Verify all returned exercises have category 'back'

description: List exercises filters by exercise type
steps: Step 2: Verify all returned exercises have exerciseType 'strength'
Step 4: Verify results only include cardio exercises

description: List exercises filters by equipment
steps: Step 2: Verify all returned exercises include 'barbell' equipment
Step 4: Verify results match equipment filter

description: List exercises searches by name
steps: Step 2: Verify returned exercises contain 'bench press' in name

description: Get exercise by ID returns full details
steps: Step 1: Get a valid exercise ID from the list endpoint
Step 3: Verify response contains all exercise fields
Step 4: Verify name, description, category, muscleGroups, equipment are present
Step 5: Verify instructions and images arrays are present

description: Get exercise by invalid ID returns 404
steps: Step 2: Verify response returns 404 Not Found
Step 3: Verify error message indicates exercise not found

description: Create custom exercise (authenticated user)
steps: Step 1: Sign in as a test user
Step 2: POST /rpc/exercise/create with valid exercise data
Step 3: Verify response contains created exercise with ID
Step 5: Verify createdByUserId matches authenticated user

description: Create custom exercise fails without authentication
Update custom exercise updates all fields
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create a custom exercise
Step 2: PATCH /rpc/exercise/update with new name and description
Step 3: Verify response contains updated exercise
Step 4: GET the exercise and verify changes persisted

description: Update exercise fails for default exercises
steps: Step 1: Get a default exercise ID (isDefault=true)
Step 2: Sign in as any user
Step 3: PATCH /rpc/exercise/update on the default exercise

description: Update exercise fails for other user's custom exercises
steps: Step 1: Sign in as User A and create custom exercise
Step 2: Sign in as User B
Step 3: PATCH /rpc/exercise/update on User A's exercise

description: Delete custom exercise removes from database
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create a custom exercise
Step 2: DELETE /rpc/exercise/delete with the exercise ID
Step 4: GET the exercise and verify 404 Not Found

description: Delete exercise fails for default exercises
steps: Step 1: Get a default exercise ID
Step 2: Sign in as any user

description: Get equipment list returns all equipment types
steps: Step 2: Verify response contains array of equipment types

description: Get muscle groups returns all muscle groups
steps: Step 2: Verify response contains array of muscle groups
Step 3: Verify main groups included (chest, back, shoulders, arms, legs, core)

description: Check name availability returns correct status
steps: Step 2: Verify response indicates name is available
Step 3: Create exercise with that name
Step 5: Verify response indicates name is taken

steps: Step 2: Navigate to create exercise page or modal

description: Create workout fails without authentication
Add exercise to workout creates workout_exercise record
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create a workout
Step 2: POST /rpc/workout/addExercise with workoutId and exerciseId
Step 3: Verify response contains workout_exercise with ID
Step 4: Verify order field is set
Step 6: Verify second exercise has higher order

description: Add set to exercise creates workout_set record
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create workout with an exercise
Step 2: POST /rpc/workout/addSet with workoutExerciseId, weight, reps
Step 3: Verify response contains set with ID

description: Add set with all fields (weight, reps, RPE, RIR, setType)
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create workout with exercise
Step 2: POST /rpc/workout/addSet with weight=100, reps=10, rpe=8, rir=2, setType='normal'
Step 3: Verify all fields are saved correctly
Step 4: Add warmup set with setType='warmup'

description: Complete workout sets completedAt timestamp
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create workout with exercises and sets

description: Get workout by ID returns full details with exercises and sets
steps: Step 1: Sign in and create complete workout with exercises and sets
Step 3: Verify response contains workout object
Step 4: Verify exercises array is present with exercise details
Step 5: Verify each exercise has sets array
Step 6: Verify set details include weight, reps, setType

description: List workouts returns user's workouts paginated

Step 6: Verify response contains remaining 2 workouts

description: List workouts only returns authenticated user's workouts

Step 2: Sign in as User B and create workouts
Step 4: Verify only User B's workouts are returned
Step 5: Verify User A's workouts are not in response

description: Update workout modifies name and notes
